description:
'''Keyshia Myeshia Cole''' ([[Birth name|née]] '''Johnson'''; born October 15, 1981) is an American singer, songwriter, television personality and actress. Dubbed by [[music critics|critics]] as the "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Princess of Hip-Hop Soul]]", she is known for her soulful voice and heartfelt lyrics. Born and raised in [[Oakland, California]], she began her career as a backing vocalist for [[MC Hammer]] before signing with [[A&M Records]] to release her debut studio album, ''[[The Way It Is (Keyshia Cole album)|The Way It Is]]'' (2005). Supported by the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] top-20 single "[[Love (Keyshia Cole song)|Love]]", the album received a [[RIAA certification|platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) and earned two nominations at the [[2006 Soul Train Music Awards]]. Its success led Cole to film a [[reality television]] series for [[BET]], in which she documented her career, family and personal life: ''[[Keyshia Cole: The Way It Is]]''. The show ran for three seasons, and became one of the most-watched programs in the network's history.

Cole's second and third albums, ''[[Just like You (Keyshia Cole album)|Just like You]]'' (2007) and ''[[A Different Me]]'' (2008), both peaked at number two on the ''Billboard'' 200 and received platinum certifications by the RIAA. The former spawned the singles "[[Let It Go (Keyshia Cole song)|Let It Go]]" (featuring [[Missy Elliott]] and [[Lil' Kim]]), "[[I Remember (Keyshia Cole song)|I Remember]]" and "[[Heaven Sent (Keyshia Cole song)|Heaven Sent]]"—each of which peaked atop the [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] chart—and received four [[Grammy Award]] nominations. Her fourth album, ''[[Calling All Hearts]]'' (2010), spawned the singles "[[I Ain't Thru]]" (featuring [[Nicki Minaj]]) and "[[Take Me Away (Keyshia Cole song)|Take Me Away]]", while her fifth, ''[[Woman to Woman (Keyshia Cole album)|Woman to Woman]]'' (2012), spawned the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs-top 10 single "[[Enough of No Love]]" (featuring [[Lil Wayne]]). That same year, she starred in her second reality series, ''[[Keyshia & Daniel: Family First]]'', alongside her then husband [[Daniel Gibson]]. Additional label swaps resulted in the [[Interscope Records|Interscope]] release of ''[[Point of No Return (Keyshia Cole album)|Point of No Return]]'' (2014) and the [[Epic Records|Epic]] release of ''[[11:11 Reset]]'' (2017).

From 2019 to 2020, Cole hosted the [[Fox Soul]]-[[broadcast syndication|syndicated]] television talk show ''[[One on One with Keyshia Cole]].''
